sources.title: 16 Fathoms Deep (1948)
sources.description: Lloyd Bridges, Lon Chaney Jr., Arthur Lake, Tanis Chandler "An Arthur Lake Production" Monogram Studios Filmed on location in Florida Although filmed in Anscocolor, most surviving versions are in black and white.

sources.title: 16 Fathoms Deep
sources.description: “Remake is equal to the original” “I absolutely loved this movie!” (IMDB reviews quotes). Adventure and drama among the sponge divers of Tarpon Springs, Florida. Good cast and production. One of Monogram’s A-features. Shot in Anscocolor, however the color prints may no longer exist. Remake of “Sixteen Fathoms Deep” (1934). IMDB rating 6.1. Directed by Irving Allen. Released in 1948. Two minutes are missing. NOTE: “Sixteen Fathoms Deep” is here: https://archive.org/details/SixteenFathomsDeep1934

metadata.Plot: Examines the dangerous business of snaring sponges on the ocean's floor that are sold via an auction exchange. Dimitri, the crooked-head of a Florida sponge-exchange, tries to prevent a boatload of valuable sponges from reaching port in time for the cargo to be sold at auction.
metadata.Writer: Max Trell, Forrest Judd, Eustace L. Adams
metadata.Actors: Lloyd Bridges, Lon Chaney Jr., Arthur Lake
